title: Green supply chain management, risk-taking, and corporate value—Dual regulation effect based on technological ... - Frontiers
summary: This research paper investigates the impact of green supply chain management (GSCM) on enterprise value. The study finds that GSCM positively influences firm value, and this effect is moderated by the level of corporate risk-taking. Furthermore, the paper analyzes the dual moderating effects of technological innovation capability (TIC) and supply chain concentration (SCC) on the relationship between GSCM and firm value.

title: The fashion exec's guide to circularity - Vogue Business
summary: The fashion industry is increasingly focused on circular fashion models to reduce waste and promote sustainability. This trend includes investments in rental, repair, resale, and recycling initiatives. However, some experts argue that the industry is overly focused on technological solutions and neglecting the social impact of these innovations, particularly in developing countries.

title: The Bay and ReturnBear Partner to Make Returns Easier Français - Canada NewsWire
summary: The Bay, a Canadian retailer, has partnered with ReturnBear, a returns management platform, to provide customers with easier returns.  The partnership allows customers to return items purchased from The Bay and its Marketplace sellers in-store, eliminating the need for shipping labels and mailing.  This initiative aims to enhance the customer experience and simplify the return process for both online shoppers and Marketplace sellers.

title: Recent Developments in Home Textiles - Fibre2fashion.com
summary: The global home textiles market is experiencing significant growth fueled by rising consumer spending and a focus on home renovation. Key trends in the sector include developments in retail, manufacturing, technology, innovation, sustainability, and circularity, with companies like IKEA, Walmart, and Macy's leading the way in implementing these changes. Companies are expanding their sourcing bases, collaborating to introduce new brands and products, and embracing innovative technologies to create sustainable and eco-friendly home textiles.

title: How Influencer Marketing will Change the Business Landscape in 2023 - Indian Retailer
summary: The article explores the potential of AI in the food and agriculture sector, highlighting its applications in various stages of the food production chain, from farming to product development and market research. AI-powered solutions are being implemented to enhance productivity, sustainability, and innovation, driving efficient resource management, improved yield predictions, and safer food practices. The article underscores the role of AI in facilitating a more sustainable and efficient food system.
